result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Edward Reifschneider DOC #211858 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).
  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Robert Edward Reifschneider DOC #211858 in court, in custody with attorney David Karpe.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 1&2 Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Court sentenced defendant on each count to 6 years prison, consecutive to any other sentence serving, consisting of 3 years confinement and 3 years Extended Supervision. Counts run concurrent with each other. $518 & $268 costs. Submit DNA sample. Defendant is not Eligible for Substance Abuse Program, is not eligible for Extended Supervision  No jail credit.

Defendant Robert Edward Reifschneider DOC #211858 in court, in custody with attorney David Karpe.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Karpe stated defendant wished for him to represent him. Defendant withdraw his motion.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.

Appointed Attorney David Karpe

Court called at 11:10 a.m., Defendant Robert Edward Reifschneider appeared by video means with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides in the courtroom.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant requested a different attorney. Court questioned defendant. Statement by Atty. Benavides. State took no position. Court granted defendant's motion for different attorney. Court advised defendant that public defender office will only appoint attorneys so many times. Court noted Judge Hepler only did initial appearance; case is assigned to Br. 2. Court adjourned at 11:30 a.m.
to Chief Judge Voigt from defendant regarding possible conflict with Judge Hepler hearing defendant's cases.
